attributes.action: Make laws to prevent the fitting of excessively noisy exhausts to motor bikes
attributes.background: There are an increasing number of motorbikes and cars with exhausts that can be heard through double glazing and from over a quarter of a mile away. They disturb sleep, prevent conversation and cause stress. Their only purpose is to draw attention to the vehicle
attributes.additional_details:
A number of motorbikes and some cars frequently disturb me, often during the night or very early morning. Most people with whom I discuss this have also been disturbed.
One motorcyclist wakes me any time between 5:30 and 6:30am. He starts from his home, which I haven't yet identified, pushing his bike, and starts it up outside my house. He clearly knows it is too loud and avoids disturbing his own family.
The Chief Medical Officer has expressed concern about air and noise pollution.

attributes.action: Introduction of a Healthcare professionals advice and liason services for Nhs
attributes.background:
I want the government to introduce a national healthcare professionals advice and liason service similar to PALS. 
Currently, when doctors and nurses are verbally, physically, racially abused or discriminated against we must document it in the patients notes and proceed with our jobs.
attributes.additional_details:
As professionals, we should have a system in place where we can raise such concerns to a professional body.
I understand that we can raise our concerns with the ward matrons and managers but enough action is not being taken. I also understand that some Trusts have something in place but as far as I am aware, a professional body aiming to protect doctors and health professionals on a national level is not available.
We are here to do our jobs and help, not to be discriminated against or abused.

attributes.action: Exempt British citizens living abroad from additional stamp duty on a UK home
attributes.background: UK citizens living abroad who wish to purchase a property for their eventual return to the UK, or for their children who may be moving to the UK, are currently caught within the net of "foreigners to be charged additional stamp duty when buying a UK property". Such individuals should be exempt.
attributes.additional_details:
Example 1: UK citizen living and working abroad now wishes to plan their return to the UK and buy a home which they will move to upon coming back to the UK to work or retire. This home should be exempt from additional stamp duty.
Example 2: UK citizen's children are moving back to the UK after growing up overseas with their parents who are living and working abroad. The parents wish to purchase a home in the UK as a base for their children. This should not be subject to additional stamp duty.

attributes.action: Reduce council tax to 50% for single occupancy households
attributes.background: Currently it's only 25% discount but it should be half of what 2 or more occupancy households pay.  A single person uses half of what two people would use for anything.

attributes.action: Guarantee help for same sex couples to start their own family
attributes.background: I have been with my partner for 3 years now and have looking to start a family for about a year but have been unable to get the funds to go private to get the help to start our own family, I work 40 hours a week full time but after bills go out there is not enough funds to save to go private.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should make sure there is funding for all same sex couples in my position.

attributes.action: Cladding Scandal-reduction in council tax until our properties are safe
attributes.background: Leaseholders left with a property value of £0 & unmortgagable properties due to the government’s reluctance to pay to resolve fire safety issues with our homes.
attributes.additional_details: We live in dangerous accommodation, we now have to foot huge bills. Council tax reflective of our £0 property values until this is resolved.

attributes.action: Better treatment, education and career possibilities for UK sea faring cadets
attributes.background: Cadets for the most part are taken on for the tax breaks afforded to the companies and as such see no career prospects with their training provider, wages are unliveable on and education should be tailored more towards the role of a sea farer.

attributes.action: Referendum asking Britain if there should be a second Brexit referendum.
attributes.background: There are many people calling for a second EU referendum and many people calling for the 2016 result to be upheld. Let’s ask the people if we should indeed have a second referendum with the question: Should there be a second EU referendum to determine whether Britain stays in the EU? Yes or No.

attributes.action: Increase the minimum wage for hgv drivers
attributes.background: I’ve been an hgv driver for 9 years and have been on the same wage with no increase, yet minimum wage keeps getting close to a skilled hgv drivers wage. The average hgv driver age is 56 and the country is short of drivers as it is (60,000)
attributes.additional_details: So in 10 years time the numbers will be far greater, so act now and increase the wage to reflect the work we do on a daily basis and encourage the younger generation to take up a career in driving, because as it stands now I wouldn’t recommend it to

attributes.action: Regulate social media to minimise the spread of hate speech and misinformation.
attributes.background: In an increasingly fractured society it is important to rein in the unchecked spread of misinformation and hate speech widespread on social media platforms. The larger companies have proven unwilling/unable to do this by themselves so they should be regulated by Ofcom.

attributes.action: Introduce impact of humans/plastic on the environment to the primary curriculum.
attributes.background: The effect we as a species have on the environment, especially when discussing plastic, is extremely important and may have considerable consequences on the lives of today's children. Educating them will help them understand how to help and protect the environment and their future.
attributes.additional_details: The response from people of all ages after watching David Attenborough's Blue Planet II was overwhelming - people want to change the way we use plastic. However children of a primary school age do not necessarily have access to the information provided by the series. Educating all children across the country allows them to make their own judgements on what is right or wrong for the future of plastics and inform them for when they're old enough to vote on such matters.

attributes.action: Make 11 November a public holiday in remembrance of the two world wars.
attributes.background: In Britain we divide our remembrance between Remembrance Sunday that takes place on the nearest Sunday to 11 November and 11 November itself which recently has gained in importance. The designation or 11 November as a public holiday would do justice to the sacrifice that we try to remember.
attributes.additional_details: Anyone who has stood under the canopy of the Menin Gate in Ypres at 8 pm and heard the last post being sounded, as it has been every evening since 1924, save for the particular circumstances of the 2nd World War, cannot fail to be moved. The designation of 11 November as a national day of remembrance and a public holiday would allow us to do justice to the sacrifice of so many that took place100 years ago.

attributes.action: Devolve the suburban rail services in London to Transport for London.
attributes.background: The suburban railways in and around London that are operated by private companies are in a bad state with delays, cancellations and general bad quality of service. TfL operated services are some of the most reliable services in the country and have seen significant improvements since TfL took over.
attributes.additional_details:
TfL's plans for devolution released back in 2016 but rejected by the DfT, seemingly for no reason at all: https://tfl.gov.uk/corporate/about-tfl/how-we-work/planning-for-the-future/developing-the-rail-network
Chris Grayling's letter to Boris Johnson detailing how he was putting politics over devolution of service in London: https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/dec/07/chris-grayling-accused-of-putting-politics-over-people-in-rail-letter-leak

attributes.action: Abolish fines for parents requesting absence from school.
attributes.background: My mum wanted to take my three little sisters on holiday abroad. She nor my sisters have seen my grandmother in nine years, and now that have finally been able to save up to go during Christmas time, they risk being fined £60 per child per leave of absence.
attributes.additional_details: All of my sisters have excellent attendance, why should my mum have to pay over £900 pounds for missing five days of school?

attributes.action: Invest at least 1% of the new Digital Tech Tax to tackle online abuse!
attributes.background: Sexism, harassment and abuse happens both on and offline. It also disproportionately affects and silences women. It is time the government took this problem seriously. It is time law enforcement caught up with online crime and time tech companies delivered real support to the users they profit from.
attributes.additional_details:
On 29 October the Chancellor announced a new digital tech tax on companies like Facebook and Twitter. We are calling for at least an annual 1% to be spent on:

1) The £200,000 that the Home Secretary announced in 2017 to spend on a UK Hate Crime Hub
2) Public education campaigns on online abuse
3) Increase police resources and capacity to adequately investigate and prosecute online abuse
4) Pilot an e-Safety Commissioner focused on e-safety of women and girls and ending online abuse

attributes.action: Ban religious studies in schools
attributes.background: Religion does not belong in the school system. I do not send my child to school to learn about religion - that is what church is for.

attributes.action: We want the Government to Stop the unjustified rise in the cost of funerals.
attributes.background: The Government needs to bring into force regulations to limit the exorbitant cost of Funerals & Cremations.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement that all unpaid carers receive appropriate training
attributes.background: Adult unpaid carers save the UK economy billions of pounds each year and despite being under supported, carers are delivering cost effective day to day invaluable care and support which for most carers becomes a full time job. Carers should have a legal right to receive appropriate ongoing training
attributes.additional_details: Local authorities are charged with supporting unpaid carers under the care act. Local authorities already ensure regular routine training and support packages to other carers, I.E. foster carers, with a dedicated support team which is made available 24/7. Local authorities should be legally bound to manage, support, provide and ensure ongoing training for unpaid carers. Without certified training, unpaid carers are being left vulnerable, unprotected and isolated.

attributes.action: Require bookmakers to give the same offers to shop and internet customers.
attributes.background: Bookmakers have promotional offers that are only available to online customers. These should be available in shops. A lot of older people have been using shops since the early sixties, these people are not computer literate and they are being denied the offers that online account customers receive.

attributes.action: Make the legal drinking age for citizens of the UK 16
attributes.background: Youths across the UK already drink without a responsible adult present.

attributes.action: Human trafficking Sex slavery: anyone found guilty receives a life sentence
attributes.background: Sex slavery one of the many forms of slavery, under the banner Human Trafficking. An estimated 4.8 million (mainly) women and children are sex slaves worldwide. They are stolen, locked up, beaten, can't leave the home , forced out as prostitutes and raped by up to 200 men a day.
attributes.additional_details: The lives of these innocent people are stolen, and if they survive they are damaged for life. The same as murder. I've read cases where the abuser has had lots of women locked up and raped all day long , even children. When he is found guilty he might only get 2 years in jail while these innocent people are destroyed. If this evil becomes a guaranteed life sentence it will decrease the numbers of victims. Any other punishment for such evil is too low. Please see: Hope for Justice, and Love for Justice international.

attributes.action: Make weekly classes  in schools about the cruel affects of bullying compulsory
attributes.background:
I am hearing all too often of children taking their own lives due to the cruel bullies making their lives a mystery.
I was bullied myself in school over 20 years ago and am shocked more hasn't been done to try to prevent it.

attributes.action: Prevent housing associations from charging tennents for essential tree work.
attributes.background: A family member of mine who lives in a housing association house had a dangerous tree in their garden. The Housing Association wanted to charge them more than £2000 to carry out the work needed to make the tree safe. I complained and won, but they continued to implement this unfair policy on others.
attributes.additional_details: Housing associations are using a loophole in the law designed for private tenants to include tree work as "standard maintenance" (along with changing bulbs) in their tenancy agreement. As the owner of the property, and therefore the tree, the housing association should be held liable for any risk posed by dangerous trees in their tenant's gardens. So forcing the tenants to pay for tree work to mitigate the risk that they (the tenant) are not responsible for is unfair and should be made illegal.

attributes.action: Abortion time to be lowered from 24 to 16 weeks.
attributes.background: Survival rates of premature babies have improved since 1990, when the law was last changed. Medical science and tech have made it easier for premature babies to survive at earlier dates. It's inhumane that this law hasn't been revised in nearly 20 years.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/1976846/Why-this-abortion-doctor-wants-to-see-time-limits-reduced-to-16-weeks.html

attributes.action: Create option to sign in opposition to any Parliament and Government petition.
attributes.background: Currently it is only possible to sign in agreement or support of any petition that is put up on this website. This is an obstacle to balanced discussion especially in cases where a petition goes to Parliament for a debate. Essentially this would be similar to MPs 'opposing' a new law, bill, etc.
attributes.additional_details: If approved there would need to be review of the current rules regarding when a governmental response is needed (10,000 signatures) or parliamentary debate (100,000 signatures). Specifically would signatures in support of and in opposition be summed up or counted separately.

attributes.action: Require teachers to wear a uniform
attributes.background: Pupils have to wear uniforms for numerous reasons and if not are punished and sent home even if parents cannot afford it. I think it would be fair for teachers to have to wear them too to set examples to the students and also for security reasons to help prevent non staff members being on site.
attributes.additional_details: When not supposed to be on site, it will also help them to be identified by the pupils and parents etc. I strongly believe that figures in authority should lead by the examples they lead and follow the same rules as the pupils with uniforms and piercing and hair cuts etc police ambulance firefighters etc all wear uniforms so teachers should too.

attributes.action: Ban child targeted advertising on unhealthy foods.
attributes.background: We have a huge obesity problem in the UK, yet we're targeting young children when selling unhealthy foods. Walking around the supermarket, I regularly see chocolate bars with Paw Patrol characters on the wrappers. This is shocking and needs to be stopped if we have any chance in tackling obesity.

attributes.action: Shale gas to guarantee no costs to taxpayers or impact on aquifers.
attributes.background: No subsidies, no research funds. More people in the UK oppose fracking than support it. Taxpayers do not want taxes spent on assisting or supporting shale gas extraction. All the costs of shale exploration and extraction must come from the companies not the taxpayer.
attributes.additional_details: Costs to be measured and paid for include: noise abatement; air quality compensation; replacing damaged aquifers with access to undamaged aquifers; subsidence and seismic damage restoration; and policing. Costs must be covered in full costs before permission for any exploration or extraction is given. Money would be better spent helping protect water supplies in droughts, preventing flooding in storms, and improving NHS and care services.
attributes.creator_name: Catherine Ann Phillips CEnv CEng FIMECHE CMIOSH PIEMA MSc BEng (Hons) PGCert

attributes.action: Create a National Care Service
attributes.background:
This country needs a sister service to the NHS to focus on social care 

Care of vulnerable and elderly citizens 

Giving  social care a new and unique identity 

This new service would create new and specialised employment with career paths offering a rewarding career with decent pay
attributes.additional_details:
Social care has a poor image , often seen as low paid casual work 
But yet so vital in this age of an older generation 
A new identity a new structure 
With new career paths is needed

attributes.action: Reform schools’ complaints system
attributes.background: The Department for Education refuse to investigate complaints from innocent students who suffer school bullying or targeting by school staff/other authorities by not obtaining all the relevant records needed for a fair investigation. We need a new body to investigate failures over the last 25 years.
attributes.additional_details: Reform the system as bullying ruins the lives of victims regardless of age or disability this new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate complaints from students/parents against schools & local authorities where children have been forced out of school, expelled, parents labelled & false reports made. Sadly, it is a daily occurrence for some schoolchildren and is sometimes so severe that victims lose out on schooling, self-harm or even take their own life. This cannot be right.

attributes.action: Utility companies to move elderly customers onto the cheapest available tariff.
attributes.background: Many elderly citizens are paying excessive amounts for gas, electricity and water. Make it law that utility companies must automatically place them on their cheapest available contracts at the time of renewal, not just place them on a standard expensive tariff.
attributes.additional_details: Utility markets are a competitive marketplace, and rightly so. Contract renewals are generally based around internet "Compare" websites that many elderly do not understand how to use. Electric and Gas suppliers are exploiting this fact by not moving them onto the best contract at renewal time. This is wrong and should be legislated against.

attributes.action: Fully fund Concessionary Travel
attributes.background:
A funding gap exists between Government allocation and the cost to councils of Concessionary Travel. The gap stands at £652million Only 50% is being supported by government; and will decrease to only 25%.
Lack of funding has led to the reduction in the councils budgets for supported bus services.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-47182101

attributes.action: That the Care Quality Commission Regulate Personal Alarm Services
attributes.background: My Mother died on Royal Wedding Day last year after being left on the floor for 78 minutes after using her personal alarm. They did not call an Ambulance.
attributes.additional_details: These services should be regulated.

attributes.action: Make it law to have every pet microchip registered to national insurance number
attributes.background: If every pets microchip was registered to the owners national insurance number any pets dumped, lost and stolen etc would be able to be traced to their owner even if microchip details are out dated.
attributes.additional_details: Too many dogs/ pets get dumped without any trace from their owners who walk away Scot free..everybody has a N.I and will always be able to be traced.

attributes.action: Stop foreign aid to countries richer than we are.
attributes.background: Britain can no longer afford to maintain foreign aid. We send billions abroad when it could be better spent on helping our own citizens. We should stop sending money to countries that have a higher GDP than the UK.

attributes.action: Change from “first past the post” to “mixed member proportional representation”
attributes.background:
Mixed Member Proportional (MMP)
Voters have two votes, one for their electorate MP and one for their preferred political party.

First Past the Post (FPP)
There is no party vote, and the representation each party has in Parliament is determined by how successful their electorate candidates are.
attributes.additional_details:
https://youtu.be/QT0I-sdoSXU

MMP
Each party’s representation in Parliament is determined by their percentage of the nationwide party vote – MPs from the party list are added to the electorate MPs to bring each party up to the same percentage of seats in Parliament.

FPP
Candidates don’t need more than 50 percent of the vote to win an electorate seat, just more than their closest opponent.

MMP is a fairer representation of its voters in parliament, as  FPP only allows for a 2 party state.

attributes.action: Lower Minimum Age of Full "A" Motorcycle License to 20 Through Direct Access
attributes.background: In 2013 the law was changed so that you could no longer get a full size motorcycle at 18 and was changed to 24
attributes.additional_details: You currently can get a full license through progressive access at 21 but that means you have to take your A1 and A2 tests before you can get it and obviously plus your CBT

attributes.action: Put the negotiated Brexit deal to the electorate.
attributes.background:
The government has negotiated a bad Brexit deal.
If this deal is the only one available from the EU this and the other options of no deal and remain should be put to the electorate for a mandate. Politicians cannot agree a way forward and no one can honestly say what was voted for in 2016
attributes.additional_details:
Minority government with no mandate for any current option. Historical failure to inform public debate by failure to place relevant data, reports and documents into the public domain in a timely manner. Lack of public trust in motives and actions of many politicians.
Without a mandate any decision - deal, leave with no deal or remain -risks alienation of a large proportion of the electorate and will set back future progress after that decision has been made. 
Democracy requires public engagement

attributes.action: Cap life insurance premiums for applicants with Mental Health problems.
attributes.background: I was medically discharged from the Armed Forces in 2016 and with this dramatic change in my life I suffered with depression and an adjustment disorder, a problem I still suffer with.  After a battle with myself I finally built up the courage to get the help I needed, but It has now taken me 2 years
attributes.additional_details: to find a company that will actually give me life insurance and within this search was point blank refused cover by multiple insurers.   After allowing an insurer to obtain a targeted medical report from my GP they have offered to cover me, but I was shocked that there was around a 200% premium increase compared to that of my wife’s. The added financial burdens will not only deter people from getting help but will also add more pressure to those affected and may hinder recovery.

attributes.action: Introduce a climate change levy on beef and dairy products
attributes.background:
The livestock sector has overshot safe limits and in particular dairy and beef production have been identified as major contributors to climate change and biodiversity loss.

Also over-consumption of these products is a fact of our unhealthy lifestyles, giving us obesity and coronary heart disease
attributes.additional_details:
A levy on these products will increase Treasury funds whilst making us more healthy whilst helping us achieve emissions targets. A win-win situation, that might also yield a reduction in the burden on the NHS similar to that brought about by reduction in smoking.

Tax receipts could be used incentivise livestock farmers to turn foresters, turning their land over for reforestation which would improve biodiversity and local air quality and allow our countryside to return to its natural state.

attributes.action: Ban websites supporting and promoting eating disorders, suicide and self harm
attributes.background:
The internet these days are widely accessed by all ages. This allows vulnerable and young people to access harmful content promoting and sharing ideas towards eating disorders, self harm and suicide. 
We would like the government to impose a ban on accessing such sites in the UK
attributes.additional_details: https://www.healthyplace.com/abuse/self-injury/why-pro-self-injury-pro-self-harm-websites-are-dangerous

attributes.action: Require smoke masks in high rise buildings to assist evacuation in a fire.
attributes.background: The safe evacuation of a high rise building would be greatly improved if residents have access to emergency smoke and oxygen masks. The masks would reduce the potentially life threatening effects of smoke inhalation and improve the chances of safe evacuation. The masks cost less than £50 currently.
attributes.additional_details: Emergency fire services are provided with breathing apparatus to access buildings on fire. Clearly providing modest masks for residents exiting a building through smoke filled lobbies and staircases would be of benefit. Moreover the masks would provide additional reassurance to residents.

attributes.action: Increase benefits to the average cost of living for all UC claims
attributes.background:
Being on benefits especially the new Universal Credit is now making financial problems for people on benefits. 
By March 2023 everyone will be claiming universal credit. The cost of living is massively higher than benefits MOST people receive. 
UC should be evened out whether you are 25 or not.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.moneyadviceservice.org.uk/en/articles/paying-your-own-way 
- Concludes the average household living cost.
 
https://www.gov.uk/universal-credit/what-youll-get 
-Shows what you will get if you are on UC 
 
It should not make a difference how old you are, there are a lot of families out there younger than 25 and the gap between the monthly payments are quite large vary age.

attributes.action: Ease the employment restrictions on asylum seekers.
attributes.background: Asylum seekers are restricted to jobs on the National Shortage Occupation List [SOL]; the reason behind their unemployed. The support they receive is inadequate for daily life [£5.39/day]; forcing them to live in poverty; relaxing the terms will make lives less vulnerable for those already in agony.
attributes.additional_details:
People seeking sanctuary in the UK could contribute £42m/year; if the work restrictions were non-existent. Millions are being spent to support destitute asylum seekers each year; this capital is possible to retain & make better use of. 

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/immigration-rules/immigration-rules-appendix-k-shortage-occupation-list

https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/oct/16/asylum-seekers-could-contribute-42m-to-uk-if-work-rules-relaxed

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-wales-45100120

attributes.action: universal credit to pay rent cost during the 4week period before first payment
attributes.background: Universal credit is causing a big problem for people falling into rent arrears at the beginning the claim by making the claimant have to wait an initial period of 4-5 weeks before issuing the first Payment in which rent arrears are building up and already people are at risk of Losing their homes.
attributes.additional_details: There used to be help for when people returned to work by giving a grace period of 1 months extra housing benefit to help with the transition from jobseekers allowance to work before the housing benefit was cancelled. Could something like this be actioned?  especially when you are moving people from an old existing benefit into the new umbrella of universal credit and rent arrears will have started accumulating. Was this 4-5wk period never thought about?! and the awful knock on effect to follow?

attributes.action: Reform use of non-disclosure agreements (NDAs) in employment
attributes.background: Settlements that include NDAs remain secret. This can perpetuate a culture of bullying and victimisation and allow abuse to remain unchallenged. All NDAs should explicitly say that employees or ex-employees are allowed to talk about any bullying and harassment they might have seen or experienced.
attributes.additional_details: The opposite view, that payments routinely reward false allegations, also leads to the same conclusion. These NDAs are inappropriate.

attributes.action: Revoke bookmakers licences if they refuse to accept bets of £20 - £100
attributes.background: Bookmakers are limiting online customers to stakes of under £5 and often less than £1. They are also banning people from promotional offers. If a bookmaker won't accept a bet of £20 or a liability of £1,000 they should not be given a licence.
attributes.additional_details: These limits and restrictions are known as gubbing. This is when a bookmaker limits a customer to small stakes (often pennies) and bans customers from promotions or closes accounts. No explanation is given for this. They just say it is a trading decision. I believe it should be a condition of being granted a licence that all bookmakers accept bets with a liability of up to £1,000.

attributes.action: Repeal Welfare Reform Act 2012 and ban outright zero hours contracts
attributes.background: The Welfare Reform Act 2012 and zero hours contracts are causing huge levels of social deprivation and poverty impacting significantly on disabled and vulnerable people which must be stopped.

attributes.action: Make Humanist weddings legally recognised in England and Wales
attributes.background: Humanist weddings have been legal in Scotland for over a decade, but in England and Wales they are not legally recognised. Couples wanting to have a Humanist ceremony have to pay to be legally married by a registrar separately to their Humanist ceremony, increasing costs and practicality issues.
attributes.additional_details:
https://humanism.org.uk/ceremonies/non-religious-weddings/faqs/

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/sep/17/humanist-weddings-scotland-england-wales

https://humanism.org.uk/2018/05/24/parliamentarians-call-for-legal-humanist-marriages-in-england-and-wales/

attributes.action: Invite Polish Armed Forces to take a part in all future Remembrance Day Parades
attributes.background: During the war, more than 200,000 members of the Polish Armed Forces in the West had fought under British High Command. The British government did not specifically invite representatives of the Polish forces that had fought under British High Command for the London Victory Celebrations of 1946
attributes.additional_details: There is no significant effort being put in acknowledging and recognition, all the effort, sacrifice of service men and women who fought in WWII under B.H.C. These people are almost gone and are still feeling betrayed and forgotten, unappreciated. It's one of the last chances for the British Government to change the mistake of the historical decisions and make it good for the future and for the post Brexit relations between Poles living in the UK and Britons.
